text.headline: Graham Miles (Douglas)
text.text:
Jan 20, 1970
Gender: Male
Ethnicity: Caucasian
Client ID: DI-ID000036085
Client Type: Shelter
Number of Housing Outcomes: 1

text.headline: Miscommunication Leads to Shouting Match in Shower
text.text:
During check ins writer heard shouting from third floor mens bathroom. Writer immediately ran to the noise following clients directions. Upon entering the washroom, writer noticed both Dave and Graham yelling at each other in the farthest shower stall. Writer seperetated the gentlemen and asked for the story. It was a miscommunication between shower stalls and who had the shower key. Both guys apologized and went to bed.

Log ID: LOG00032115

text.headline: Vayia Found with Pill Bottle, Graham Claims Ownership
text.text:
Earlier this evening Writer observed Client Vayia Michalopoulos (Via Michael (Vaia Miles), TRESPASS NOTICE ISSUED) 1976-08-10 in the front entrance holding a full green pill bottle. Writer observed Vayia take a couple pills, close the bottle, and place it in her sock. Writer asked Vayia if he can call DOAP team for her, which she said yes. Writer left, called DOAP team, then returned and observed Client Graham Miles (Graham Chaisson) 1970-01-20 speaking with Vayia and holding the green pill bottle; but it was empty. Writer asked Vayia where the pills were, to which she replied they were in her sock. Then Writer asked Graham if the bottle was his, to which he said yes. Writer asked why Vayia had the bottle, to which he said he didn’t know. He then appeared to be upset at Vayia, so Writer asked him to either enter the building or leave; he chose to enter. Vayia then sat for a bit waiting for DOAP team, then left on her own after an unknown amount of time. Writer reviewed footage and observed Graham quickly slip the pill bottle into Vayia’s jacket pocket; there did not appear to be any transaction. Writer confiscated the empty pill bottle. Writer made acting Supervisor Kirsten aware of the interaction; who also noticed the bottle had mixed meds in it due to multiple different prescription labels on the bottle.Footage can be seen on 1st floor East, Main Entrance

Log ID: LOG00230897

text.headline: Lifting of Bar and Housing Discussions with Graham
text.text:
Graham Miles 1970-01-20: Graham was informed that drug sharing is strictly prohibited and any further instances would result in a lengthier bar. Graham was receptive to working with staff in the housing hub towards finding a home downtown and presented as highly motivated to move out. Bar LIFTED.

Log ID: LOG00039555

text.headline: Scheduling Housing Intake Interview for Graham
text.text:
Graham M agreed to meet with Housing staff for his intake interview on Dec 21, 2018 at 1:00 PM in front of the 2nd floor day office.

Log ID: LOG00395231

text.headline: Graham's Aggressive Behaviour at the Water Fountain
text.text:
At about 7:30 this morning writer witnessed Graham Miles shove another client that was waiting for the water fountain. Writer asked why he did it, and he said he was just annoying him. Writer asked him to head out till lunch time.

Log ID: LOG00234238

text.headline: Drug Findings and 30-Day Bar for Graham
text.text:
Due to suspicion of dealing in the building, Grahams belongings were searched this afternoon. Upon search, 768mg of liquid methadone, fresh dime bags, as well as copious amounts of mixed medications and street drugs were found and turned over to security to be assessed by the nurses.Grahams bed on 5th floor has been closed, and A 30 day bar has been placed.

Log ID: LOG00236826

text.headline: Unknown Client and Casey Attack Graham
text.text:
Early morning in the shift, Sup Elise and Writer noticed some distress between a few clients on dermont baldwin way. The camera was quickly panned and staff noticed unknown client whipping a chain at Graham in attempts to harm him. Graham made his way onto property and into the biometrics while the unknown client and Casey followed onto property behind him. The unknown client dropped the chain, and it was picked up by Casey who was the only one who entered the biometrics behind Graham. Casey came in posturing at Graham with the chain, which prevented staff from interfering for safety reasons. Casey dropped the chain and attacked Graham in the corner of the entrance bio door by striking a few punches at his face. Staff interevened when Casey started walking away and let Graham into the building. 911 was put in during the time and unit #1115, 1112 arrived shortly after to assess Graham. Casey rode his bike off property going west under the 4th ave fly over bridge.

Log ID: LOG00021186

text.headline: Graham Stabs Ruben while Being Attacked
text.text:
Early morning, writer and Sup Elise noticed Graham running towards the DI property while being chased by two individuals identified as Isaac Chacun and Ruben Amenares. Once Graham was let into the building, it was notified by Isaac that Graham had a knife and Sup Elise requested him to give it up, which Graham did with no argument. The knife was put into the security and Graham was given access to use the washroom. Moments later, Ruben was being walked in by Isaac with a shirt held tightly to his throat. Sup Elise quickly let Ruben into the building, and Sup Ryan was putting down a 911 call for Ruben. Sup Elise and Writer clarified to Ruben that an EMS would be arriving shortly. Graham walked out of the riverfront washroom and started posturing to Ruben until writer intervened and sent Graham back into the riverfront sleeping area. EMS# 2808 arrived and transported Ruben to Foothills hospital. CPS#1147, 1115, 1112, 1134 arrived as well for the situation. After footage review, it is seen Graham walking away along 4th st while being followed by Isaac and Ruben, who attempt to attack him. Graham appears to pull out a knife in his left hand and strikes Ruben's throat than runs on property.

Log ID: LOG00021194

text.headline: Housing Documentation Update with Graham
text.text:
Housing documentation: Writer met with Graham and discussed housing options. Writer completed an ROI update and NSQ with Graham and added him back to the triage list for CAA. Writer then discussed how a rent report works and Graham took a few with him and will follow up with writer this week.

Log ID: LOG00405130

text.headline: Graham Threatens Matthew Armstrong
text.text:
Writer was outside of the office when Matthew Armstrong stated that he was near the smoke deck minding his own business when Graham Miles started threatening him. Graham Miles then came bursting onto the ladies side yelling at Matthew, something about having $50. Graham then exited the ladies side and writer asked Matthew to write down what threats were made by Graham. Matthew wrote "Ya little puke, ya think nothings coming to you as soon as you get far enough away from this this place. I'm gonna smash your head in! $50 to whoever smashes this kids head in. Matthew swears that he did not steal anything belonging to Graham. Writer showed the note written by Matthew to Supervisor Cara and Jeremy. Supervisor Jeremy then showed the note to security.

Log ID: LOG00410168

text.headline: Graham Criticizes 3rd Floor Staff Behaviour
text.text:
Writer was working at the lobby and Graham Miles came to the elevator, going to 2nd. floor. While waiting, writer was about to start a conversation with Graham with whom writer has a good rapport, but Graham started by saying "staff on 3rd floor are complete assh***s, the people that work here on 3rd before you start your shift". Writer asked Graham why he was saying such things, and he went on making comments on the way staff wake clients up in the morning and mentioned also that they quickly get the coffee out of the office to throw it before anyone can take any, "they don't really care if you are volunteering for a chore or not, they just don't f*** care if you do anything, they just rather to throw it out instead of giving some to people". Writer asked Graham if he has ever approached staff to talk about those issues and he said "no, but I will". Then he left.

Log ID: LOG00411615

text.headline: Medical Attention for Graham After Fall
text.text:
Few minutes before dinner, Graham Miles-20-Jan-1970 was given a medical attention by the nurses on men’s 3rd. At around 19.38 pm, writer was alerted by client Cesar Zuñiga-Gomez (Ivan) -10-Dec-1953 that Miles had falling flat on his back. ACW Josiah and writer rushed to the scene and found him on the floor. A call to the nurses brought in Nurse Jeo; who again checked on him and returned awhile later; as a follow, up. Emergency services were not involved and client seemed to be in a stable condition.

Log ID: LOG00412809

text.headline: Emergency Call After Graham Coughs Blood
text.text:
Client alerted staff that Graham Miles (Graham Chaisson/ 2507) 1970-01-20 he needs a staff. ACW Eric went to check on him, client stated that he was in pain. ACW Eric noticed that he was coughing blood and then called the nurse to check on him. LPN Navi told ACW Eric to bring him down to the nursing office and it was decided to placed a 911 call. EMS Unit#3224 arrive at 2:33am and took him to an unknown location.

Log ID: LOG00412835

text.headline: Missed Connection for Housing Discussion with Graham
text.text:
Writer (Claire) went to Graham's bed to meet with him however, he was not there. Writer then left my card on his bed for him to call me. Graham later called me however, I was on the other line. Graham stated he was leaving for a doctor appt and would call writer back once he was back. PLEASE ENCOURAGE GRAHAM TO CALL ME ASAP REGARDING HIS HOUSING

Log ID: LOG00415604

text.headline: Phone Discussion about Alpha House Contact
text.text:
Writer (Claire) spoke with Graham over the phone and passed along the Alpha House contact for his housing. Graham stated he would call right away. Writer then emailed Sam with Alpha to let her know Graham has her details and to let me know if he doesn't get in touch.

Log ID: LOG00416012

text.headline: Update on Graham's Plan to Move into Sunalta
text.text:
Writer (Claire) left a voicemail for Graham and spoke with Sam from Alpha regarding his meeting with her last Saturday. Sam with Alpha stated Graham wants to move in Wednesday or Thursday this week. Writer will hopefully connect with Graham to help assist with him moving into Sunalta.

Log ID: LOG00416355

text.headline: Finalization of Graham's Move into Sunalta
text.text:
Writer (Claire) let Sunalta know Graham has chosen to move in Friday Oct 8th. Graham stated he didn't want to stay at the DI and would be leaving today. Writer ask he call me tomorrow and let me know where he is so DOAP could take him to Sunalta, which he agreed.

Log ID: LOG00416613

text.headline: Graham Collects Belongings, Plans to Move Out
text.text:
GRAHAM MILES came in to grab the rest of his belongings because he's moving into his own place today! MILES was very excited. He did state that he would need to come back tonight to grab his bike however.

Log ID: LOG00416702

text.headline: Graham's Return to DI After Failed Housing
text.text:
GRAHAM MILES came to the guard shack to check in, in the database he did sleep at the DI on March 2nd. MILES said that his housing that he'd secured didn't work out and that he's hoping to work with Calgary Housing to get housed again.

Log ID: LOG00431865

text.headline: Confiscation of Glass Tube from Graham in Washroom
text.text:
Writer was doing walkthroughs and writer did washroom checks on the 3rd Floor. Writer entered the washroom closest to the elevator vestibule, knocked on stall door 1 and client Graham Miles (20-Jan-1970) was not responding to any safety washroom checks. ACW Lisa and Writer quickly opened stall #1. With a few taps and shakes to the shoulder. Client Graham Miles jumped up to get dressed and a piece of glass tube fell down from clients pocket. Writer confiscated the glass tube and escorted client out of the washroom.

Log ID: LOG00434606

text.headline: Graham Complains of Lingering Lung Issues
text.text:
Around 10:30AM on April 24th 2021, Writer allowed client GRAHAM MILES (20/01/1970) access to the 3rd Floor Men's Area through the Main Stairwell. While MILES entered the area, he commented on how he was struggling with his lungs and had been for the past "little bit". MILES stated that he did not believe it was COVID-19 and did not want to see an LPN when prompted by Writer, however he did say he was going to see a doctor later in the week. MILES gave a similar response to ACW Laura K when she inquired about his health. Logging for health issues.

Log ID: LOG00437796

text.headline: Graham Barred for an Hour After Verbal Assault
text.text:
Graham Miles approached the gate upset that he was not woken up for breakfast. He began yelling at writer to let him in. Writer refused him entry until he was able to calm himself down, to which he told writer to "fuck off." Writer went back to the gate and Graham began yelling at writer again. Writer again told Graham that he would not be granted access until he was able to calm himself down. As writer was going inside the guards hack, Graham yelled at writer to "go take a dick." Graham was given a one hour bar, and when he was told this he gave writer the finger.

Log ID: LOG00442166

text.headline: Graham Miles' Aggressive Actions and Non-Accountability
text.text:
This morning writer came to learn that Graham Miles had written on the third floor office window when he learnt that he had missed breakfast. Soon after writer observed that Graham was in an escalated state and began angerly banging on the guard shack while requesting to exit. When Graham Miles returned he was still quite escalated, When ACW Sydney did not immediately grant him access to property he turned his aggression towards her and and began yelling and cursing, eventually Graham walked away after giving her the finger. Writer placed an hour bar. Once Graham' bar had expired he returned to the gate and writer was called down to the gate to speak with him. Graham did not take any accountability for his actions, he stated that writing on the window was unimportant because it can just be washed off, and the way he had treated staff was not worth talking about because the people that work here need to learn how to suck it up. I told Graham that it was unfortunate that he had missed breakfast, but ultimately he should be responsible for how he chose to act. Graham immediately escalated and stated that he sick of the stupid bitches that get hired to work here, and the first thing he would do when he got in the building was lock him self in a shower and masturbate to thoughts of that stupid girl getting raped. Again, I told Graham that his behavior towards the situation was not acceptable, and that I would not be granting him access. Graham stated that he wanted to speak to a real Supervisor when he returns.

Log ID: LOG00442190

text.headline: Discovery of Prohibited Items with Graham Miles
text.text:
Writer was doing a morning walkthrough and saw a glass bubble pipe in GRAHAM MILES' (20-Jan-1979) lap who was asleep at bed 73. Writer consulted ACW Airen. Writer and Airen approached MILES and ACW Airen explained building guidelines, that glass pipes are prohibited on property and gave him the option to tote the pipe or discard it and asked if he had other paraphernalia to tote, and MILES said no. MILES opted to tote the pipe. Writer noticed a small bag of purple powder when MILES got up and this was also toted. Writer escorted MILES to lobby and helped him with a tote.

Log ID: LOG00443501

text.headline: Graham Miles' Misbehavior in the Washroom
text.text:
Writer was opening the shower for a client and heard a someone in the washroom stall lighting a torch lighter. Writer knocked on the door and asked client to come out when the door opened it was Graham M with a torch lighter in his hand. While Graham was leaving the bathroom he dropped a glass pipe on the floor and tried to smash it . Graham was going to get his jacket at his bunk and he became angry and kicking bunk beds while going to his bed. Graham became agitated so writer called for a removal SEC Nalosco came onto the floor and escorted Graham out. Graham can come back at 7:00am.

Log ID: LOG00446428

text.headline: Graham Miles Threatens Suicide by Overdose
text.text:
Around 10:00AM on 07-06-2021, GRAHAM MILES came to the gate and asked to be let out and for some Safeworks. Writer grabbed the Safeworks and MILES told Writer that now he was going to go kill himself by overdosing. Writer told SEC Garrett E. who crossed the street and informed a police officer who was across the street. The police officer informed SEC Garrett that they would keep an eye out for him. Security kept eyes on MILES as he crossed the Reconciliation Bridge until he was out of camera sight.

Log ID: LOG00446507

text.headline: Graham Miles' Violation of Guidelines and Aggression Towards Staff
text.text:
Graham Miles was found with a bubble pipe at his bed, and Graham said to just throw it away. After looking up Graham's profile he was informed that he was receiving a CAT 1 to leave the building for an hour, Graham threw a cup in anger almost hitting ACW Colton. ACW Marvin was witness to this and informed Graham that he would be receiving a 24 hour bar for both having the pipe and then showing aggression. Graham did ask for his pipe back as he was leaving and said he would not leave without it, however it had already been disposed of. Graham did leave the floor, however with a lot of yelling and hitting walls

Log ID: LOG00446599

text.headline: Medical Emergency with Graham Miles on the 3rd Floor
text.text:
Writer was alerted to a possible medical medical emergency on 3rd floor. Writer arrived to find a client non responsive in the bathroom stall. Writer and staff attempted to pop the door but due to the lock being bent we were unable to pop the lock and Writer had to hop over from the other stall. Once Writer got in the stall the client was identified as Graham Miles and became responsive. Graham was presenting as under the influence due to his erratic movement and speech. Writer, ACW Marvin and ACW Zoe helped Graham to a mat where he was placed on regular checks.

Log ID: LOG00456435

text.headline: Suicidal Ideations from Graham Miles Over Lost Phone
text.text:
Writer was alerted by ACW Zoe of Graham Miles who was stating suicidal ideations after waking up and not being able to find his phone. Graham stated that if he didn't get his phone he was going to take 5 points of meth and then 7 points of meth and kill himself. Due to this and the fact that Graham had already been found in the bathroom using a 911 call was placed CPS arrived and assessed the situation but did not believe Graham posed a big enough threat to himself so he has been placed on regular checks.

Log ID: LOG00456439

text.headline: Conflict Between Graham Miles and Nathan Whyte Over Bed Dispute
text.text:
ACW Stacey called for assistance in the third floor men's dorms. Writer attended. There, Graham Miles 1970-01-20 and Nathan Whyte 2000-11-04 were yelling at each other. ACW Stacey disclosed Graham M spat on Nathan W due to a bed dispute. Allegedly, Nathan W fell asleep on Graham M's bed, causing Graham M to spit on Nathan W in frustration. Graham M excitedly confirmed he had spat on Nathan W and would do it again. ACW Stacey and writer escorted Graham M off the floor. Graham M claimed Nathan W kicked him. Writer asked when this happened, to which Graham M responded, "It doesn't matter." ACW Stacey and writer explained that it does matter but Graham M refused to explain himself further. On the way down and in the lobby, Graham M stated he would harm Nathan W in any way possible. Writer explained to Graham M he is getting a bar and is losing his bed as a result of his actions.

Log ID: LOG00467212

text.headline: Concerns Over Graham Miles' Health During Breakfast Service
text.text:
During breakfast service writer came across client Graham Miles (Jan.20th 1970) heavy on the nod and fell out of his chair knocking his breakfast everywhere. Writer offer to get Graham a medical assessment but Graham declined medical treatment. Writer was concerned as Graham left property with another client. If staff can keep eyes on Graham when he returns.

Log ID: LOG00472658

text.headline: Medical Emergency Involving Graham Miles on Dermot Baldwin Way
text.text:
Writer was alerted to a medical emergency on Dermot Baldwin way and found Graham Miles 20 Jan 1970. On the ground foaming at his mouth. Graham was responsive and able to stand with some help. Nursing took miles inside the main building

Log ID: LOG00485096

text.headline: Graham Miles' Housing Preferences and Future Appointment
text.text:
Housing Connect- Writer met with Graham Miles regarding housing, client refuses to work with Alpha House housing again and wants housing with Calghary Housing Company. Client wants to update his needs services questionnaire and writer will meet with client this week, wednesday to do such including signing a new coordinated access assessment roi

Log ID: LOG00499469

text.headline: Graham Miles Obstructs Writer's View During Walkthrough
text.text:
Writer was doing a walkthrough in the bunk area of Day Sleep at 3:30pm and Graham Miles decided to hold up his jacket to block writer's view of Jayson Youngberg at his bunk. Jayson had tin foil and a hooter and later writer found a bubble on his bunk as well. Writer placed a bar and he understood he was to go out for his bar. Writer clarified that if he does not use the tote system, there will be escalating consequences.

Log ID: LOG00509934

text.headline: Graham Miles Obstructs Writer's View During Walkthrough - Repeat
text.text:
Writer was doing a walkthrough in the bunk area of Day Sleep at 3:30pm and Graham Miles decided to hold up his jacket to block writer's view of Jayson Youngberg at his bunk. Jayson had tin foil and a hooter and later writer found a bubble on his bunk as well. Writer placed a bar and he understood he was to go out for his bar. Writer clarified that if he does not use the tote system, there will be escalating consequences.

Log ID: LOG00511017

text.headline: Graham Miles Expresses Interest in Detox Program
text.text:
DETOX/RECOVERY PROGRAM, client: GRAHAM MILES stated he was interested in DETOX. The writer filled out the paperwork and gave it to Nurse Leah. GRAHAM is currently on a CAT 4, however, because of his interest in DETOX, SPVRs have allowed GRAHAM access to the the 4th floor program under supervision only.

Log ID: LOG00518430

text.headline: Compassion Access Granted to Graham Miles Awaiting DOAP Team Arrival
text.text:
DOAP Team was called to transport barred client Graham Miles (20-Jan-1970) to Alpha house. DOAP Team let staff know that due to a high volume of calls they would most likely not be able to transport him until the morning. MILES was presenting as weak and had trouble standing which resulted in multiple falls outside the front gate. Due to vulnerability MILES was granted compassion access until DOAP Team arrives.

Log ID: LOG00520695
